text: Hello everyone, I am Mandar Valerao.
I am currently an M.Tech student at IISC Bangalore in Computer Science and Automation.
I am also a cloud computing enthusiast.
My journey in cloud technology began with a challenge at Amazon Web Services to manage
a project with a strict budget which was $30. I am proud to say that I completed it with
$22 demonstrating my skill in efficient cloud resource management.
I understand the importance of not just running systems but running them cost effectively which
is a crucial skill for any role at Google.
So this experience is a way in which I stand out as a cloud engineer.
My academic background is also the time where I built the foundation.
I studied computer architecture which is very critical for understanding infrastructure
of cloud services.
I have also tackled machine learning systems learning to handle the kind of large scale
data processing applications that are at the heart of cloud computing.
I have also completed my internship at Western Union.
At Western Union, I worked on a tool that improved financial transactions through better
user experience.
It was a practical application of cloud analytics and we boosted the conversion rates significantly.
In another project, I developed a recommendation system handling thousands of data points.
It's a kind of big data challenge that is common in cloud services.
My technical skills are in Python and C++ and I have familiarity with tools like Jupyter
Notebook and Google Colour.
It means that I am well prepared for the technical challenges at Google.
My achievements in the coding competitions demonstrate my problem solving skills and
abilities.
What sets me apart is not just my technical skills but my ability to learn quickly and
adapt qualities that I know which are essential at Google.
I am ready to bring my cloud computing skills to the table not just to do a job but to innovate
and help Google lead the way in cloud services.
In conclusion, my technical skills, my proven track record in cloud management and quick
adaptability are the exact rates that Google looks for a cloud engineer.
I am not just ready to join the Google Cloud team, I am also ready to innovate, drive efficiency
and contribute to the groundbreaking work that defines Google.
Thank you for the opportunity to share my vision and excitement to be a part of shaping
the cloud's future at Google.
